message:
Recent and extensive Palestinian public opinion survey: 73% support Hamas' decision to launch the October 7th attack

Today, the Palestinian Center for Political Studies and Surveys published a comprehensive survey it conducted at the end of May on a variety of burning questions related to the current war.
The survey included about 1570 participants, half of them from the West Bank and half from Gaza.

Viewed from above, the survey shows an upward trend in the Palestinian public's support for Hamas and its actions, and confidence that it will win the war and remain in control of Gaza even after it.

Here is a variety of data from the survey:

73% of the respondents answered: Hamas made the right decision when it went to war on 10/7 - this is the highest figure for this question since the beginning of the war.

96% of the Palestinians who did not watch the 10/7 videos do not believe that Hamas committed atrocities against Israeli civilians.

54% of the Palestinians who saw the videos from 10/7 do not believe that Hamas committed atrocities against Israeli civilians.

79% of respondents believe that Hamas will win the war - the highest rate since the beginning of the war.

61% of the respondents in the survey prefer that Hamas continue to rule the Gaza Strip after the war (71% of the residents of the West Bank and 46% of the residents of the Gaza Strip prefer this to be the case).

In the event of an election for the PA presidency between Abu Mazen and Ismail Haniyeh, Abu Mazen will win 5% of the votes and Ismail Haniya 46% of the votes. 46% have announced that they will not vote in the elections.

The rate of support for Hamas and Fatah in general elections:
17% will support Fatah
41% will support Hamas

Only 32% of the survey respondents support the two-state solution for two peoples.

52% support the armed struggle as a way to end the occupation and establish an independent Palestinian state.
The a-Najma Square area in the west of Rafah - it used to be one of the busiest places in Rafah, where in recent months the local market was also located.
USA: Hamas supporters set fire to the Israeli flag and the US flag in front of the Israeli consulate building in New York, in protest of the continued fighting in Gaza
Al Jazeera presents: the Swedish village in the southwest of Rafah - before and after

Sources associated with the Assad regime on the video of the IDF soldiers shooting the catapults 👆:
"The occupation army acts like its allies, the Syrian rebels, in the first years of the civil war in Syria."

Iraq: Oil refinery facilities in Erbil (Kurdistan Region) have been on fire since yesterday.

Sources associated with the Iranian axis claim that Kurdish oil from this region will find its way to Israel in the coming days.

Los Angeles USA:
Pro-Palestinian protesters/terrorists took over a floor of a building at California State University in LA while holding lecturers from the university's academic staff, including the president of the university, hostage in the building.

##
That's how it is when your role model is a terrorist organization that kidnaps people... Maybe this will wake up some Americans who still don't understand what's going on around them.

This is undoubtedly one of the most popular videos this morning on the Lebanese and Palestinian channels.
According to the Lebanese channels, this is how the IDF causes fires in southern Lebanon.

Only missing swords and armor... and the Game of Thrones crew🔥
An example from this morning of the detonation of several explosives planted in one of the roads in Jenin - the IDF continues to strip the roads in the area.

The Palestinians report that the IDF has been operating in the Jenin area and the Jenin refugee camp for about five hours.
They complain about the fact that the IDF destroys the road infrastructure in the area just days before Eid al Adha.

A video sent to me by the follower R. from the beach near the place where the settlement of Pe'at Sade in the south of the Gaza Strip was located before the disengagement.
Taken in the last few days.

Are the Christians in Lebanon preparing for war?

An unknown organization calling itself "Rebellion" posted recruitment ads targeting young Christians in Lebanon.
The ads were hung near the church in the Ashrafia neighborhood in Beirut, the capital of Lebanon, and with the approval of the church.

##
In this context, I will point out that many Christians in Lebanon (and not only) wish for Israel's victory over Hezbollah and are counting on Israel to rescue Lebanon from the suffocating grip of Hezbollah.
This is part of recent Lebanese discourse.
Israel has important allies in Lebanon.

IDF advance in Rafah:

Gaza sources report a ground advance from south to north of maneuvering forces and tanks in the urban area of ​​Rafah's Mawasi - near the seashore and the Flag Square area.

The IDF denied morning reports of attacks in the humanitarian area in Mawasi (located north of there in the Khan Yunis district).

Saudi Arabia: Arab channels report an unprecedented military deployment in the city of Mecca that includes the introduction of troops and military equipment seen there for the first time.
According to the Saudis, the purpose of the extensive deployment is to maintain public order in the holy city of Islam, during the days of the pilgrimage.
The destruction in the eastern part of the Bureij refugee camp in the center of the Gaza Strip after the departure of IDF forces from there last week.
Before and after: the Yabneh refugee camp in Rafah in the south of the Gaza Strip (located near the Philadelphi axis, roughly in the middle of it).

Al Jazeera: The US Congress has approved the introduction of changes in the budget of the US Department of Defense in a way that will prevent the transfer of funds for the reconstruction of the Gaza Strip.

Following the personal attack by senior Hamas official Osama Hamdan on the US Secretary of State Blinken, last night Hamas issued an official proclamation in which it stated:

The positions expressed by the American Secretary of State Blinken, through which he tries to clear Israel of guilt and accuse Hamas of responsibility for not reaching an agreement, are a continuation of the US policy that allows the continuation of the crimes of the occupation under American military-political cover.
We call on Blinken and the Biden administration to put pressure on the fascist occupation government that insists on completing the genocide.

##
Hamas made a decision to address Blinken personally.
